content:
I apologize for the confusion and any frustration caused. There is no limit to the size of my response, and I am here to provide as much detail as possible to assist you.

To address your questions:

1. My previous response was incomplete because I accidentally left out the breakdown of raw pumpkin seeds again.
2. To reiterate, here is the complete breakdown of the nutrients and vitamins (quantity and % DV) in 100 grams of raw almonds, cashews, sunflower seeds, and pumpkin seeds:

**Raw Almonds:**

* Calories: 579
* Total Fat: 49g (75% DV)
* Saturated Fat: 3.7g (18% DV)
* Sodium: 1mg (0% DV)
* Total Carbohydrates: 22g (7% DV)
* Dietary Fiber: 12g (48% DV)
* Sugars: 3.9g
* Protein: 21g (42% DV)
* Calcium: 264mg (26% DV)
* Iron: 3.7mg (20% DV)
* Potassium: 705mg (20% DV)
* Magnesium: 268mg (67% DV)
* Vitamin E: 25.6 mg (170% DV)
* Thiamin (B1): 0.2 mg (12% DV)
* Riboflavin (B2): 1.1 mg (64% DV)
* Niacin (B3): 3.4 mg (17% DV)
* Vitamin B6: 0.1 mg (5% DV)
* Folate (B9): 60 mcg (15% DV)
* Vitamin B5 (Pantothenic acid): 0.5 mg (10% DV)

**Raw Cashews:**

* Calories: 553
* Total Fat: 44g (68% DV)
* Saturated Fat: 7.8g (39% DV)
* Sodium: 12mg (0% DV)
* Total Carbohydrates: 30g (10% DV)
* Dietary Fiber: 3.3g (13% DV)
* Sugars: 5.2g
* Protein: 18g (36% DV)
* Calcium: 37mg (4% DV)
* Iron: 6.7mg (37% DV)
* Potassium: 565mg (16% DV)
* Magnesium: 292mg (73% DV)
* Vitamin E: 0.9 mg (6% DV)
* Thiamin (B1): 0.4 mg (27% DV)
* Riboflavin (B2): 0.1 mg (7% DV)
* Niacin (B3): 1.1 mg (6% DV)
* Vitamin B6: 0.4 mg (20% DV)
* Folate (B9): 25 mcg (6% DV)
* Vitamin B5 (Pantothenic acid): 0.9 mg (18% DV)

**Raw Sunflower Seeds:**

* Calories: 584
* Total Fat: 51g (78% DV)
* Saturated Fat: 4.5g (22% DV)
* Sodium: 2mg (0% DV)
* Total Carbohydrates: 20g (7% DV)
* Dietary Fiber: 8.6g (34% DV)
* Sugars: 2.6g
* Protein: 21g (42% DV)
* Calcium: 78mg (8% DV)
* Iron: 5.0mg (28% DV)
* Potassium:
